summary: In the football match between Blackpool and Colchester United, the score ended 1-1. The first goal was scored by Jamille Matt for Blackpool after 12 minutes, assisted by Nathan Delfouneso. Colchester equalized after a goalmouth scramble from a corner kick. Both teams had chances to score, with Blackpool's Tom Aldred heading wide from a good position and Colchester's George Elokobi and Kurtis Guthrie having shots saved. Colchester finished the game with 10 men after substitute Sean Murray was sent off for a bad tackle. There were numerous fouls and injuries throughout the match.

Nathan Delfouneso scored the first goal for Blackpool after 12 minutes, and Jamille Matt equalized for Colchester from a free kick. Blackpool's Sam Slocombe made a save to deny Matthew Briggs, but Kurtis Guthrie scored a rebound from a corner. Colchester failed to regain the lead, with George Elokobi and Sean Murray receiving yellow cards. Blackpool had a chance to win the match but missed a shot from Tom Aldred. The game ended with Colchester playing with 10 men after Sean Murray received a red card.

summary: Blackpool and Colchester United tied 1-1. Blackpool scored first after 12 minutes when Nathan Delfouneso passed to Jamille Matt, who scored. Colchester tied the game after 17 minutes when Kurtis Guthrie scored after a goalmouth scramble. Colchester had a chance to take the lead before halftime, but Blackpool's goalkeeper Sam Slocombe made a save. Blackpool had a chance to win the game 15 minutes before the end, but Tom Aldred missed a header. Colchester finished the game with 10 men after Sean Murray was given a red card for a bad tackle.

source: The Seasiders struck with the first real chance after 12 minutes as Nathan Delfouneso jinked past his man and delivered a pinpoint chip into the area, where Jamille Matt turned the ball home from three yards.Blackpool goalkeeper Sam Slocombe denied Matthew Briggs with a sensational save to push the ball behind after 17 minutes, but the visitors did equalise from the resulting corner as Kurtis Guthrie prodded in from close range after a goalmouth scramble.Somehow, Colchester failed to re-take the lead on the stroke of half-time as Slocombe produced a brilliant save from George Elokobi's close-range effort, before Guthrie headed against the bar from two yards.Blackpool should have clinched the win 15 minutes from time, as Tom Aldred was found unmarked from a corner, but he headed wide from eight yards.Colchester finished the game with 10 men, after substitute Sean Murray was shown a straight red for a bad tackle on Jim McAlister in injury time.Report supplied by the Press AssociationMatch ends, Blackpool 1, Colchester United 1.Second Half ends, Blackpool 1, Colchester United 1.Foul by Jamille Matt (Blackpool).Chris Porter (Colchester United) wins a free kick in the attacking half.Attempt missed. Both teams had chances to score, with Blackpool missing a good opportunity to win the game. Colchester finished the match with 10 men after Sean Murray was shown a red card for a bad tackle. The match ended in a 1-1 draw.

summary: The match between Blackpool and Colchester United ended in a 1-1 draw. Blackpool took the lead after 12 minutes with a goal from Jamille Matt, assisted by Nathan Delfouneso. Colchester equalized five minutes later through Kurtis Guthrie following a corner. Blackpool's goalkeeper, Sam Slocombe, made several crucial saves, including a notable one from George Elokobi just before halftime. Blackpool missed a key chance to win the game when Tom Aldred headed wide from a corner. Colchester ended the match with 10 men after Sean Murray was sent off for a bad tackle in injury time.
